formattedAddress: 518 W 27th St, New York, NY 10001, USA
adrFormatAddress: 518 W 27th St, New York, NY 10001, USA

editorialSummary.text: Cool watering hole featuring tapas & cocktails, plus views of the city & Empire State Building.

originalText.text: Very good tacos, atmosphere and service. The tacos were Served quickly and with a smile. I had the mushroom tacos and was very pleased. The mushroom was grilled maitaake and the salsa was üî•

text.text: Very good tacos, atmosphere and service. The tacos were Served quickly and with a smile. I had the mushroom tacos and was very pleased. The mushroom was grilled maitaake and the salsa was üî•

originalText.text: Had an amazing time the food and drinks were marvellous, Melina provided great service she was attentive and gave us good recommendations and made really good cocktails.  will be back for sure. Very excited to to find a spot as we‚Äôve been looking for a new place to have dinner in the neighbourhood.

originalText.text:
I‚Äôm struggling to find any kind words to say about this place. The service here was probably the worst I‚Äôve experienced at any bar or restaurant. When we walked in, the staff seemed to be unwilling to help and had the attitude of not really caring. Our waiter took our order once and came back to our table once more later on but we never saw her again after that. If we needed anything else, we would have to go inside to find her. She even left for the day without checking on us. The sad thing was that there were only 4-5 other tables seated in the whole bar at the time. The drinks and food were alright but the chips and guac could definitely use more chips given its price.

Overall this was a really sad experience and the staff really needs to do a better job tending to customers and losing the ‚Äúwhatever‚Äù attitude.

originalText.text:
We only went because my girlfriend had purchased a PUSLD Voucher thinking it was for Selina (a Spanish tapas restaurant)‚Ä¶

We should have looked at the reviews before buying a voucher. But nonetheless, we came on a Friday in October. There were maybe 4 patrons in the entire rooftop. Two people behind the bar and one person behind the kitchen (the kitchen staff was so bored he was on his phone the whole time).

The bartenders / bar staff seemed so confused as to input any voucher or make any drinks. The training here is sub par. We ordered 2 Palomas‚Ä¶. WRONG CHOICE! They didn‚Äôt have any tequila , the grapefruit juice tasted like cheap grapefruit soda‚Ä¶ without the voucher , each drink would have been $16 ‚Ä¶ waste of money / time. We ended up leaving the drinks there.

Now time for the food. The arepas and fried yuca tasted exactly the same as if the oil was never changed. We also left the food on the table.

Great location. With great potential. But honestly, save your time and money. The staff isn‚Äôt experienced . The food is bad. Management needs to step it up and get a new staff and training system in place. Otherwise the rooftop business will fail.

The views are the only thing this rooftop has, but you can go to dozens of other rooftops on the city and get great views.

Wouldn‚Äôt be coming back here anytime soon, nor recommending anyone to come here.
